result.execSummary:
The defendant Carleen D Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.
  • MA-Fraud/Benefit Application (Items), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 49.49(1)(a)1.
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,522,307.56 plus surcharges.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Cts.3&4 but Consecutive to Ct.1.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Storm appears from the Attorney General's Office and for the State. Defendant, Carleen D Larson, appeared with Attorney Patrick J. Knight.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments are made.  
Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP;  2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.  DE is taken into custody.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Counts 2, 3 and 4 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Each count is concurrent but Consecutive to Count 1.  
Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $1,522,307.56.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Amicus Curiae - Affidavit
